definition[0]: an arrangement in which a loan is provided by a group of companies, especially banks or insurance companies
example[0]: Bank regulators have argued that thrifts will have to begin arrangingsyndications ofloans.
definition[1]: the sale of articles, photographs, or radio or television programmes to several newspapers, television stations etc
example[1]: The TV company distributes three of the most popular television shows in syndication.
definition[2]: a method of selling something, especially property, in which a company or group of companies sells shares in it to investors
example[2]: Companies that participated in the syndication might be less likely to join in a similar deal next time.
